description: The shooting of three Israelis by IDF troops shows the risks of armed intervention in hostage situations.
maintext: In the case of Al-Qaeda in Iraq and the Islamic State group (IS), the jihadist kidnappers never really had any intention of releasing their US and British captives. Instead they were aiming for maximum psychological impact by killing them on camera. In those situations, armed intervention, if they can be located, is usually the only option available.
title: Israel Gaza: The perils of hostage rescue
